mapper.sql: id, name, last_version, download_link, create_date, modify_date, deleted
mapper.select: select count(id) from jh_version where deleted = 0

select
from jh_version where deleted = 0 limit #{0},#{1}
mapper.delete: delete from jh_version where deleted = 0 and id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
mapper.insert: insert into jh_version (id, name, last_version, download_link, create_date, modify_date, deleted) values (#{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}, #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{lastVersion,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{downloadLink,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{modifyDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{deleted,jdbcType=INTEGER})

insert into jh_version
id,
name,
last_version,
download_link,
create_date,
modify_date,
deleted,

mapper.update:
update jh_version
name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
last_version = #{lastVersion,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
download_link = #{downloadLink,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
modify_date = #{modifyDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
deleted = #{deleted,jdbcType=INTEGER},
where deleted = 0 and id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}

update jh_version set name = #{name,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, last_version = #{lastVersion,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, download_link = #{downloadLink,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_date = #{createDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, modify_date = #{modifyDate,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, deleted = #{deleted,jdbcType=INTEGER} where deleted = 0 and id = #{id,jdbcType=INTEGER}
